GT.content: truth of gift would be (un)veiled by veil of tears rather than sight
GT.linkedContent: truth of gift would be (un)veiled by veil of tears rather than sight

HASD.content: since promise is also an order, allegorical veil becomes political shield, solid barrier of a social division, a shibboleth
HASD.linkedContent: since promise is also an order, allegorical veil becomes political shield, solid barrier of a social division, a shibboleth

HASD.content: [re: negative theology] a politics of initiation or teaching, multiplication of voices, veil (predicate) dissimulates & renders attractive at same time
HASD.linkedContent: [re: negative theology] a politics of initiation or teaching, multiplication of voices, veil (predicate) dissimulates & renders attractive at same time

POOF.content: what chance does a feminine friend have on a stage where truth must always be veiled, prudent, where even the perhaps’ indecency might still ask truth, woman, to remain in veils
POOF.linkedContent: what chance does a feminine friend have on a stage where truth must always be veiled, prudent, where even the perhaps’ indecency might still ask truth, woman, to remain in veils

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s veiled truth of decency > do veil & decency signify absence of courage?
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s veiled truth of decency > do veil & decency signify absence of courage?

POOF.content: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?

MSUBJ.content: “nature” conceals even the source of its interdiction > Artaud wants to tear apart veil of birth and reveal “naked nature”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: “nature” conceals even the source of its interdiction > Artaud wants to tear apart veil of birth and reveal “naked nature”

WM.content: as moment of detour in which truth might still be lost, metaphor belongs to mimēsis, fold of physis, veiling, when nature has yet to re-find its proper nudity
WM.linkedContent: as moment of detour in which truth might still be lost, metaphor belongs to mimēsis, fold of physis, veiling, when nature has yet to re-find its proper nudity

DS.content: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being
DS.linkedContent: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being

DS.content: Mallarmé: as of this date, a veil
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: as of this date, a veil

DS.content: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire
DS.linkedContent: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire

DS.content: the rape has already taken place and will nevertheless never have been perpetrated > caught in folds of veil: where all truth comes undone
DS.linkedContent: the rape has already taken place and will nevertheless never have been perpetrated > caught in folds of veil: where all truth comes undone

DS.content: if veil was lifted (blind us to death) by closing or bursting
DS.linkedContent: if veil was lifted (blind us to death) by closing or bursting

SP.content: [re: Nietzsche’s “—Distanz!”] hyphen & exclamation mark invite us, by way of pirouette & play of silhouette, to keep distance from veils [woman] that make us dream of death
SP.linkedContent: [re: Nietzsche’s “—Distanz!”] hyphen & exclamation mark invite us, by way of pirouette & play of silhouette, to keep distance from veils [woman] that make us dream of death

SP.content: Heidegger’s Entfernung, de-ferment, distantiation of distance, veiled enigma of proximation, distance itself constituted by destruction (Ent-)
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Entfernung, de-ferment, distantiation of distance, veiled enigma of proximation, distance itself constituted by destruction (Ent-)

SP.content: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”
SP.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”

SP.content: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil
SP.linkedContent: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil

SP.content: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]
SP.linkedContent: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]

SP.content: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable
SP.linkedContent: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable

SP.content: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant
SP.linkedContent: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant

O.content: Mallarmé: lift a corner of the veil, fragment of total book—scintillate (the whole that’ll never be) ——Derrida places logic of veil alongside that of corner > prelude, en passant, improbably place of dissemination
O.linkedContent: Mallarmé: lift a corner of the veil, fragment of total book—scintillate (the whole that’ll never be) ——Derrida places logic of veil alongside that of corner > prelude, en passant, improbably place of dissemination

SW.content: sighing (together) before the “veil,” wanting to finally touch the it > to touch “veil” is to touch everything, leaving nothing intact, safe & sound: get caught up in it, nothing will remain
SW.linkedContent: sighing (together) before the “veil,” wanting to finally touch the it > to touch “veil” is to touch everything, leaving nothing intact, safe & sound: get caught up in it, nothing will remain

SW.content: waiting for a quasi-resurrection, in view of a first/last time, that has nothing to do w/ unveiling (w/ truth)
SW.linkedContent: waiting for a quasi-resurrection, in view of a first/last time, that has nothing to do w/ unveiling (w/ truth)

SW.content: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let
SW.linkedContent: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let

SW.content: [re: Exodus 26:31] there are 2 veils/curtains btwn [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle & [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle of tabernacles [of holies/of sanctuaries] > 1st embroidered by artist, 2nd merely the work of a carpenter
SW.linkedContent: [re: Exodus 26:31] there are 2 veils/curtains btwn [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle & [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle of tabernacles [of holies/of sanctuaries] > 1st embroidered by artist, 2nd merely the work of a carpenter

SW.content: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?
SW.linkedContent: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?

SW.content: “for they shall make a sanctuary, I shall dwell in their bosom” > veil, curtain, drape is dwelling of God, his ethos, this Who (that dwells) is also a What, a 3rd party, the Law, text of law
SW.linkedContent: “for they shall make a sanctuary, I shall dwell in their bosom” > veil, curtain, drape is dwelling of God, his ethos, this Who (that dwells) is also a What, a 3rd party, the Law, text of law

SW.content: absolute knowledge will not accept that there will be nothing behind the curtain (in the veiled place of le tout autre: nothing that is in the present)
SW.linkedContent: absolute knowledge will not accept that there will be nothing behind the curtain (in the veiled place of le tout autre: nothing that is in the present)

SW.content: the remaining intact or tearing of the veil is the same: l’une se garde de l’autre > 2 liftings (deux relèves), you want to have finished w/ the veil: to have finished w/ oneself, that’s the veil
SW.linkedContent: the remaining intact or tearing of the veil is the same: l’une se garde de l’autre > 2 liftings (deux relèves), you want to have finished w/ the veil: to have finished w/ oneself, that’s the veil

SW.content: just where you finish it—it will survive you > shroud: sums up essence of veil
SW.linkedContent: just where you finish it—it will survive you > shroud: sums up essence of veil

SW.content: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts
SW.linkedContent: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts

SW.content: Celan: scarcely has an image burst in then it remains suspended in the web: half image, half veil
SW.linkedContent: Celan: scarcely has an image burst in then it remains suspended in the web: half image, half veil

SW.content: verdict neither torn nor lifted cloth > if veil is neither torn nor lifted is it still not hung btwn holy & holy of holies? > who knows? we must dare the “perhaps”: “the fulgurating nearness of this day depends/tends” toward who or what I know not yet
SW.linkedContent: verdict neither torn nor lifted cloth > if veil is neither torn nor lifted is it still not hung btwn holy & holy of holies? > who knows? we must dare the “perhaps”: “the fulgurating nearness of this day depends/tends” toward who or what I know not yet

SW.content: I am so fatigued from knowing truth, that history of the veil—that truth: too old for me, too old like me (however young I remain) > you don’t know the “fatigue” I’m talking about (dreaming of writing in Spanish, forgotten ancestral language)
SW.linkedContent: I am so fatigued from knowing truth, that history of the veil—that truth: too old for me, too old like me (however young I remain) > you don’t know the “fatigue” I’m talking about (dreaming of writing in Spanish, forgotten ancestral language)

SW.content: infinite weariness of tropes, what do you expect, I want to end it all (protest, attestation, testament, manifesto against the shroud) > no longer write around/in/under folds of truth
SW.linkedContent: infinite weariness of tropes, what do you expect, I want to end it all (protest, attestation, testament, manifesto against the shroud) > no longer write around/in/under folds of truth

SW.content: complaint (of exhaustion) & accusation lodged against matrix of discourse of veil
SW.linkedContent: complaint (of exhaustion) & accusation lodged against matrix of discourse of veil

SW.content: complain about myself to myself: immodesty, impudence > but veil makes modest
SW.linkedContent: complain about myself to myself: immodesty, impudence > but veil makes modest

SW.content: complaint: give up all modesty, most elementary politeness
SW.linkedContent: complaint: give up all modesty, most elementary politeness

SW.content: phantasm of thing itself an effect of the veil, veiled cause of nudity/modesty/shame/Verhaltenheit, of law, everything that hides & shows the sex
SW.linkedContent: phantasm of thing itself an effect of the veil, veiled cause of nudity/modesty/shame/Verhaltenheit, of law, everything that hides & shows the sex

SW.content: Derrida’s written too much on the veil, his penelopean works [provides a list if you think he’s lying]
SW.linkedContent: Derrida’s written too much on the veil, his penelopean works [provides a list if you think he’s lying]

SW.content: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket
SW.linkedContent: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket

SW.content: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me
SW.linkedContent: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me

SW.content: epuisement recalls the water & the well (le puits) of truth, back to the pit, the hole (puteus)
SW.linkedContent: epuisement recalls the water & the well (le puits) of truth, back to the pit, the hole (puteus)

SW.content: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?
SW.linkedContent: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?

SW.content: as though fate of humanity depends again on who holds power over women about the veil (St. Paul, abusive interpretation of Koran) [sin, fall or Verfallen, therefore the veil]
SW.linkedContent: as though fate of humanity depends again on who holds power over women about the veil (St. Paul, abusive interpretation of Koran) [sin, fall or Verfallen, therefore the veil]

SW.content: when one cannot read original language, one is lost in translations (veils, fringes or clothing, panels, wings, corners)
SW.linkedContent: when one cannot read original language, one is lost in translations (veils, fringes or clothing, panels, wings, corners)

SW.content: culture of tallith, of shawl (not culture of veil): blessing and death
SW.linkedContent: culture of tallith, of shawl (not culture of veil): blessing and death

SW.content: fault or election, veil is worn as a sign of mourning
SW.linkedContent: fault or election, veil is worn as a sign of mourning

SW.content: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”
SW.linkedContent: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”

SW.content: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling
SW.linkedContent: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling

SW.content: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being
SW.linkedContent: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being

SW.content: what if the fantasy (the arm) and truth (the unveiled) are on same side, same rib (du côté de la même côte) (man woman) [deconstruction of sexual difference] > extricate before opposing absence to presence [Freud’s penis envy]: of the Thing (Phallus, Penis, Cause) behind Veil
SW.linkedContent: what if the fantasy (the arm) and truth (the unveiled) are on same side, same rib (du côté de la même côte) (man woman) [deconstruction of sexual difference] > extricate before opposing absence to presence [Freud’s penis envy]: of the Thing (Phallus, Penis, Cause) behind Veil

SW.content: unlike the veil, the tallith depends on One of the unique, singular event whose repetition repeats only, and that’s history, the “only once” of the Law given
SW.linkedContent: unlike the veil, the tallith depends on One of the unique, singular event whose repetition repeats only, and that’s history, the “only once” of the Law given

SW.content: tallith can become a shroud [shroud is essence of veil, so, in relation to time of verdict, is tallith no longer/not yet tallith as shroud? (see pp. 312, 318)]
SW.linkedContent: tallith can become a shroud [shroud is essence of veil, so, in relation to time of verdict, is tallith no longer/not yet tallith as shroud? (see pp. 312, 318)]

SW.content: tallith as trace of date, event of singularity, not lifting, unfolding of veil—“even if one translates this gift of the Law as Revelation, the figure of the veil,” the taking-place of the event counts more than the “intuition & movement of vision”
SW.linkedContent: tallith as trace of date, event of singularity, not lifting, unfolding of veil—“even if one translates this gift of the Law as Revelation, the figure of the veil,” the taking-place of the event counts more than the “intuition & movement of vision”

SW.content: unlike veil, tallith is the difference of the event, irreducible reference to the One, the One + n > cannot be or become (like every veil) a figure, symbol, because of the uniqueness of its reference, the untranslatable carry of this ference (which one cannot/must not get rid of)
SW.linkedContent: unlike veil, tallith is the difference of the event, irreducible reference to the One, the One + n > cannot be or become (like every veil) a figure, symbol, because of the uniqueness of its reference, the untranslatable carry of this ference (which one cannot/must not get rid of)

SW.content: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere
SW.linkedContent: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere

SW.content: St. Paul wanted to veil heads of women & unveil those of men, he denounced children of Israel for not knowing how to lift the veil (over face of God, covenant, on heart) > he wonders how service of breath/spirit/life (not death) wouldn’t be more luminous, unveiling
SW.linkedContent: St. Paul wanted to veil heads of women & unveil those of men, he denounced children of Israel for not knowing how to lift the veil (over face of God, covenant, on heart) > he wonders how service of breath/spirit/life (not death) wouldn’t be more luminous, unveiling

SW.content: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal
SW.linkedContent: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal

SW.content: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)
SW.linkedContent: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)

SW.content: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)
SW.linkedContent: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)

SW.content: thought of event (moment of verdict) w/out truth unveiled/revealed, w/out phallogocentrism of greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freudo-heideggeriano-lacanian veil, w/out phallophoria, w/out (un)veiling of phallus
SW.linkedContent: thought of event (moment of verdict) w/out truth unveiled/revealed, w/out phallogocentrism of greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freudo-heideggeriano-lacanian veil, w/out phallophoria, w/out (un)veiling of phallus

SW.content: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk, sperm, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)
SW.linkedContent: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk, sperm, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)

SW.content: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]
SW.linkedContent: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]

REST.content: hypokeimenon as underneath, what is the fundamental ground of subjectivity? [re: Van Gogh’s shoes]: the “sole,” the rhythmic pas de contact of a march/walk/step, the ground, what about veils, the stocking (le bas), as what’s underneath the text?
REST.linkedContent: hypokeimenon as underneath, what is the fundamental ground of subjectivity? [re: Van Gogh’s shoes]: the “sole,” the rhythmic pas de contact of a march/walk/step, the ground, what about veils, the stocking (le bas), as what’s underneath the text?

REST.content: thing hidden away, wrapped up underneath its investiture
REST.linkedContent: thing hidden away, wrapped up underneath its investiture

REST.content: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen
REST.linkedContent: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen

REST.content: Derrida wonders if topos of abyss (a fortiori mis-en-abyme) might dampen (amortir) the angular necessity of this other topic, other pas: undecidables, la figure du voilement, du linge voilant, l’hymen, la soquette ou le bas, entre pied et chaussure

REST.content: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being

REST.content: Heidegger’s step backward from truth of adequation to truth of unveiling can leave one disarmed in face of precritical, dogmatic, in face of “preinvestment” (fantasmatic, ideological)
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s step backward from truth of adequation to truth of unveiling can leave one disarmed in face of precritical, dogmatic, in face of “preinvestment” (fantasmatic, ideological)

D.content: tout “commence” donc par la citation, dans les faux plis (creases) d’un certain voile, of a certain mirror-like screen
D.linkedContent: tout “commence” donc par la citation, dans les faux plis (creases) d’un certain voile, of a certain mirror-like screen

TN.content: Chrétian admits to a veil in finite touch, a “phenomenological occultation” of the creature
TN.linkedContent: Chrétian admits to a veil in finite touch, a “phenomenological occultation” of the creature

TN.content: immediacy of touch [its illusion] may be most widespread philosophical naiveté
TN.linkedContent: immediacy of touch [its illusion] may be most widespread philosophical naiveté

TN.content: pudeur: elle déploie ses voiles à l'infini > must must not, because can can’t (confess/betray)
TN.linkedContent: pudeur: elle déploie ses voiles à l'infini > must must not, because can can’t (confess/betray)

TN.content: la loi marque ainsi le sans dan le sens ou dans l’existence ——a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]
TN.linkedContent: la loi marque ainsi le sans dan le sens ou dans l’existence ——a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]

ATAP.content: numerology, Plato’s amazement w/ geometric figures, illumination, Pythagorean mysticism, vision—all belong to apocalyptic world, crypto-politics, -poetics, [for Kant] perversion of philosophy > matter of veil & castration [that is, who will unveil? who speaks w/out mastery?]
ATAP.linkedContent: numerology, Plato’s amazement w/ geometric figures, illumination, Pythagorean mysticism, vision—all belong to apocalyptic world, crypto-politics, -poetics, [for Kant] perversion of philosophy > matter of veil & castration [that is, who will unveil? who speaks w/out mastery?]

ATAP.content: acc. Kant, mystagogues anticipate, approach, smell out, are men of imminence & the trace, new Platonists, abuse metaphors & figurative expressions (bildlichen Ausdrücken) > they bring into play the phantom & the veil
ATAP.linkedContent: acc. Kant, mystagogues anticipate, approach, smell out, are men of imminence & the trace, new Platonists, abuse metaphors & figurative expressions (bildlichen Ausdrücken) > they bring into play the phantom & the veil

ATAP.content: via Kant, apocalypse as dream of raising (aufheben) veil of Isis
ATAP.linkedContent: via Kant, apocalypse as dream of raising (aufheben) veil of Isis

SPEC.content: curtain (rideau): canvases, veils, hymens, umbrellas > Derrida neither has time nor taste (goût) to show how they accord to same law (accomplished by itself or done w/out)
SPEC.linkedContent: curtain (rideau): canvases, veils, hymens, umbrellas > Derrida neither has time nor taste (goût) to show how they accord to same law (accomplished by itself or done w/out)

SPEC.content: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations
SPEC.linkedContent: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations

SPEC.content: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da

FV.content: Bouhours: metaphors are transparent veils, costumes, beneath which one recognizes the costumed person

FV.content: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream

FV.content: Freud pays no attention to a fold in the text [Emperor’s…], literary narrative is a secondary elaboration, thus an Einkleidung > since Andersens’ text has the text as its theme, it puts Freud’s text [interpretation] onstage

FV.content: hidden theme of Emperor’s… is the hidden theme, text as its theme, text as veil, movement of alētheia
